snippet: The future of “The Michael J. Fox Show” does not look good, but Mr. Fox is concentrating on making sure the last seven episodes that were filmed are actually seen by audiences.
abstract: Michael J Fox, whose ratings-challenged NBC comedy The Michael J Fox Show has been off the air for weeks, says in telephone interview that cancellation is not inevitable; is concentrating on making sure that last seven episodes filmed, which he considers best of the series, are actually seen by audiences in hopes that it will improve ratings.
lead_paragraph: The future of “The Michael J. Fox Show” does not look good, but Mr. Fox is concentrating on making sure the last seven episodes that were filmed are actually seen by audiences.

headline.main: Michael J. Fox Says No Series ‘Death Sentence’ Yet
headline.print_headline: Michael J. Fox Says No Series ‘Death Sentence’ Yet
